body.name: The Paris Assignment: A Novel
body.description: A courageous wife, mother, and resister confronts the devastation of World War II in a heartbreaking and hopeful novel by the bestselling author of The Venice Sketchbook and The Tuscan Child.Londoner Madeleine Grant is studying at the Sorbonne in Paris when she marries charismatic French journalist Giles Martin. As they raise their son, Olivier, they hold on to a tenuous promise for the future. Until the thunder of war sets off alarms in France.Staying behind to join the resistance, Giles sends Madeleine and Olivier to the relative safety of England, where Madeleine secures a job teaching French at a secondary school. Yet nowhere is safe. After a devastating twist of fate resulting in the loss of her son, Madeleine accepts a request from the ministry to aid in the war effort. Seizing the smallest glimmer of hope of finding Giles alive, she returns to France. If Madeleine can stop just one Nazi, it will be the start of a valiant path of revenge.Though her perseverance, defiance, and heart will be tested beyond imagining, no risk is too great for a brave wife and mother determined to fight and survive against inconceivable odds. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Captivating story that’s so beautifully written.
reviews.reviewText: Let me start by saying that historical fiction is my absolute favorite genre. This novel was one of my favorite reads in 2023! The story starts off in France and the beginning was so charming! I couldn’t help but fall in love with the main characters immediately. As the storyline progresses, there is war, heartbreak, and resilience. The author gives us a glimpse into the events of WW2 which focuses on France’s war with the Germans. In addition to this, we are also told about Australia’s less talked about role in the war. This novel took me for an emotional rollercoaster ride and I loved every second of this book. 10/10 would recommend. Will definitely be buying more from this wonderful author.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: An enjoyable read, albeit predictable at times. Well drawn characters. Fans of her Molly McGuire series should enjoy this novel.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Some dark moments in a sea of compelling narrative about a dark time in our history. Ms. Bowen is a masterful storyteller and you need to read these books to know why I say this. Enjoy an action packed love story of valor and intrigue.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The history is so rich. The plot and the suspense makes it hard to put this book down. I enjoy all this authors books

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Satisfying book right in the begining
reviews.reviewText: My ancestral background is French so this book sounded interesting

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Another Rhys Bowen winner
reviews.reviewText: Great read for lovers of WWII historical fiction. Great way to spend a winter afternoon. I always enjoy Rhys Bowen books.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars The Paris Assignment
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed reading the book but as it evolved it unfortunately was very predictable!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I enjoy reading books based on WWII experiences. This was a captivating story and held my interest throughout.

reviews.reviewTitle: This author always write amazing books
reviews.reviewText: I have never read a book written by her that I did not enjoy including this one. I could not put it down. Read the entire book in a day and half, and would have liked it to continue.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: France - occupied yet still energised with a spirit of resistance. An English woman becomes a spy. Her French husband a hero. The unexpected fires the narrative with a relemtless force capturing the reader in an inescapable hold. I recommend it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Brilliant, I couldn't stop reading it
reviews.reviewText: A truly awesome saga with magic and love and courageI truly couldn't stop reading it and was totally caught up in the characters

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This book had twists and turns that kept me wanting to read more. The story took you through sadness of wartime and hope in the aftermath.

A story that reflects on human despair sadness and determination through despicable moments of cruelty during the WW2 German fascists occupation of FranceThis story provides a glimpse into the disgusting side of human behaviour in war while adding a very intimate account of love and determination to surviveA must read for all
